HTMLTableCellElement.summary: The HTMLTableCellElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of table cells, either header cells ({{HTMLElement("th")}}) or data cells ({{HTMLElement("td")}}), in an HTML document.

remarks.para: -The HTML elements implementing this interface: th and td.

HTMLTableCellElementAbbr.summary:
The abbr property of the interface
indicates an abbreviation associated with the cell. If the cell does not represent a header cell th, it is ignored.

remarks.para: It reflects the abbr attribute of the th element.

blockquote.para: This property doesn't have a visual effect in browsers. It adds information to help assistive technology like screen readers that can use this abbreviation

HTMLTableCellElementAlign.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The align property of the interface is a string indicating how to horizontally align text in the {{htmlelement("th")}} or {{htmlelement("td")}} table cell.

blockquote.para: This property is deprecated, and CSS should be used to align text horizontally in a cell. Use the CSS text-align property, which takes precedence, to horizontally align text in a cell instead.

HTMLTableCellElementBgColor.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The HTMLTableCellElement.bgColor property is used to set the background color of a cell or get the value of the obsolete bgColor attribute, if present.

blockquote.para: This property is deprecated and CSS should be used to set the background color. Use the background-color property instead.

HTMLTableCellElementBgColor.value:
One of the following value types can be used:
NOTEThe values accepted here are a limited subset of the CSS color values. Only named-color and 3- or 6-digit hex-color (with no alpha-channel). While all HTML color values are valid in CSS, this is not true in the other direction.

HTMLTableCellElementCellIndex.summary:
The cellIndex read-only property of the interface
represents the position of a cell within its row (tr). The first cell has an index of 0.
HTMLTableCellElementCellIndex.value: Returns the index of the cell, or -1 if the cell is not part of any row.

HTMLTableCellElementCh.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The ch property of the interface does nothing. It reflects the char attribute of the cell element.

blockquote.para: This property was designed to participate to the ability to align table cell content on a specific character (typically the decimal point), but was never implemented by browsers.
To achieve such alignment, watch for the support of a string value with the text-align CSS property.

HTMLTableCellElementChOff.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The chOff property of the interface does nothing. It reflects the charoff attribute of the cell element.

blockquote.para: This property was designed to participate in an ability to align table cell content on a specific character (typically the decimal point), but was never implemented by browsers.
To achieve such alignment, watch for the support of a string value with the text-align CSS property.

HTMLTableCellElementColSpan.summary: The colSpan read-only property of the interface represents the number of columns this cell must span; this lets the cell occupy space across multiple columns of the table. It reflects the colspan attribute.
HTMLTableCellElementColSpan.value:
A positive number representing the number of columns.
NOTEWhen setting a new value, the value is clamped to the nearest strictly positive number.

HTMLTableCellElementHeaders.summary:
The headers property of the interface
contains a list of IDs of th elements that are headers for this specific cell.

HTMLTableCellElementNoWrap.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The noWrap property of the interface returns a Boolean value indicating if the text of the cell may be wrapped on several lines or not.

blockquote.para: This property is deprecated and you should use the CSS white-space property with the value nowrap instead.

HTMLTableCellElementRowSpan.summary: The rowSpan read-only property of the interface represents the number of rows this cell must span; this lets the cell occupy space across multiple rows of the table. It reflects the rowspan attribute.
HTMLTableCellElementRowSpan.value:
A positive number representing the number of rows. If it is 0, it means all remaining rows in the column.
NOTEWhen setting a new value, a value different from 0 is clamped to the nearest strictly positive number.

HTMLTableCellElementScope.summary:
The scope property of the interface
indicates the scope of a th cell.

remarks.para: Header cells can be configured, using the scope attribute, to apply to a specified row or column, or to the not-yet-scoped cells within the current row group (that is, the same ancestor thead, tbody, or tfoot element). If no value is specified for scope, the header is not associated directly with cells in this way. Permitted values for scope are:

blockquote.para: This property doesn't have a visual effect in browsers. It adds semantic information to help assistive technology like screen readers to present the table in a more coherent way.

HTMLTableCellElementVAlign.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The vAlign property of the interface is a string indicating how to vertically align text in a {{htmlelement("th")}} or {{htmlelement("td")}} table cell.

blockquote.para: This property is deprecated. Use the CSS vertical-align property to horizontally align text in a cell instead.
